item.title: Dior begins sending data breach notifications to U.S. customers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The House of Dior (Dior) is sending data breach notifications to U.S. customers informing them that a May cybersecurity incident compromised their personal information. [...]

item.title: Over 1,000 CrushFTP servers exposed to ongoing hijack attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over 1,000 CrushFTP instances currently exposed online are vulnerable to hijack attacks that exploit a critical security bug, providing admin access to the web interface. [...]

item.title: Learn 14 Languages from Babbel with this exclusive StackSocial deal
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Learning a new language doesn't have to mean night classes, bulky textbooks, or boring apps. With Babbel, you can pick up real-world conversation skills through short, fun, and practical lessons. And right now, you can get a lifetime subscription for only $159 (regularly $599). [...]

item.title: Dell confirms breach of test lab platform by World Leaks extortion group
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A newly rebranded extortion gang known as "World Leaks" breached one of Dell's product demonstration platforms earlier this month and is now trying to extort the company into paying a ransom. [...]

item.title: Microsoft releases emergency patches for SharePoint RCE flaws exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released emergency SharePoint security updates for two zero-day vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771 that have compromised services worldwide in "ToolShell" attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft SharePoint zero-day exploited in RCE attacks, no patch available
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Critical zero-day vulnerabilities in Microsoft SharePoint, tracked as CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771, have been actively exploited since at least July 18th, with no patch available and at least 85 servers already compromised worldwide. [...]

item.title: HPE warns of hardcoded passwords in Aruba access points
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE) is warning of hardcoded credentials in Aruba Instant On Access Points that allow attackers to bypass normal device authentication and access the web interface. [...]

item.title: Threat actors downgrade FIDO2 MFA auth in PoisonSeed phishing attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A PoisonSeed phishing campaign is bypassing FIDO2 security key protections by abusing the cross-device sign-in feature in WebAuthn to trick users into approving login authentication requests from fake company portals. [...]

item.title: Popular npm linter packages hijacked via phishing to drop malware
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Popular JavaScript libraries eslint-config-prettier and eslint-plugin-prettier were hijacked this week and turned into malware droppers, in a supply chain attack achieved via targeted phishing and credential theft. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT's GPT-5-reasoning-alpha model spotted ahead of launch
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: GPT-5 might be just a few days or weeks away, as we've spotted references to a new model called gpt-5-reasoning-alpha-2025-07-13. [...]

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google may disrupt education market with new AI tools
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: AI companies could soon disrupt the education market with their new AI-based learning tools for students. [...]

item.title: New CrushFTP zero-day exploited in attacks to hijack servers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: CrushFTP is warning that threat actors are actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-54309, which allows attackers to gain administrative access via the web interface on vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: Arch Linux pulls AUR packages that installed Chaos RAT malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Arch Linux has pulled three malicious packages uploaded to the Arch User Repository (AUR), which were used to install the CHAOS remote access trojan (RAT) on Linux devices. [...]
